data.chText: 通常不用于进行时
data.enText: not usually used in the progressive tenses

data.chText: 过去的人 / 事物
data.enText: sb/sth from the past

data.chText: 回想起；记得；记起
data.enText: to have or keep an image in your memory of an event, a person, a place, etc. from the past

data.chText: 这位是卡拉。你记得她吗？
data.enText: This is Carla. Do you remember her?

data.chText: 我已经忘了第一天上学的情景。
data.enText: I don't remember my first day at school.

data.chText: 他记忆中的她依然是他多年以前认识的那个活泼的少女。
data.enText: He still remembered her as the lively teenager he'd known years before.

data.chText: 我记得这是我们第三次会面了。
data.enText: As far as I can remember , this is the third time we've met.

data.chText: 你记得我们出来之前关灯了吗？
data.enText: Do you remember switching the lights off before we came out?

data.chText: 我隐约记得听到他进来。
data.enText: I vaguely remember hearing him come in.

data.chText: 爷爷教我打纸牌的情景我记忆犹新。
data.enText: I can still vividly remember my grandfather teaching me to play cards.

data.chText: 我不记得他请过哪怕一天假。
data.enText: I can't remember his taking a single day off work.

data.chText: 我记得我们过去经常在周末去看望他们。
data.enText: I remember (that) we used to go and see them most weekends.

data.chText: 事实；信息
data.enText: fact/information

data.chText: 想起；记起
data.enText: to bring back to your mind a fact, piece of information, etc. that you knew

data.chText: 对不起——我想不起你的名字了。
data.enText: I'm sorry─I can't remember your name.

data.chText: 你能回忆起我们花了多少钱吗？
data.enText: Can you remember how much money we spent?

data.chText: 你说要帮着我做的。记得吗？
data.enText: You were going to help me with this. Remember?

data.chText: 别忘了我们今天晚上要出去。
data.enText: Remember that we're going out tonight.

data.chText: 记住；把…牢记在心
data.enText: to keep an important fact in your mind

data.chText: 记住，吃了这些药片之后，你可能会犯困。
data.enText: Remember (that) you may feel sleepy after taking the pills.

data.chText: 不要忘记大多数事故都是在家里发生的。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语 (+ that从句)

data.enText: It should be remembered that the majority of accidents happen in the home.

data.chText: 必做之事
data.enText: sth you have to do

data.chText: 记着，不忘（去做）；动手做（必须做的事）
data.enText: to not forget to do sth; to actually do what you have to do

data.chText: 你到了之后别忘了给我打电话！
data.enText: Remember to call me when you arrive!

data.chText: 你记得带家庭作业了吗？
data.enText: Did you remember your homework (= to bring it) ?

data.text: Notice the difference between remember doing sth and remember to do sth :

data.enText: I remember posting the letter

data.text: means ‘I have an image in my memory of doing it’;

data.enText: I remembered to post the letter

data.text: means ‘I didn't forget to do it.’
注意remember doing sth和remember to do sth之间的区别：I remember posting the letter的意思是“我记得把信寄出去了”；I remember to post the letter的意思是“我没有忘记要寄信”。

data.chText: 祈祷时
data.enText: in prayers

data.chText: 纪念；缅怀；思念
data.enText: to think about sb with respect, especially when saying a prayer

data.chText: 纪念战争死难者的教堂礼拜仪式
data.enText: a church service to remember the war dead

data.chText: 送礼
data.enText: give present

data.chText: 给…送钱（或礼品等）
data.enText: to give money, a present, etc. to sb/sth

data.chText: 我姨妈在我的生日总要送我礼物。
data.enText: My aunt always remembers my birthday (= by sending a card or present) .

data.chText: 他爷爷在遗嘱中给他留下了一笔钱。
data.enText: His grandfather remembered him (= left him money) in his will.
be remembered for sth
be remembered as sth

data.chText: 因某事而成名（或名留青史）
data.enText: to be famous or known for a particular thing that you have done in the past

data.chText: 他因为将爵士音乐传到英格兰而为人们所熟知。
data.enText: He is best remembered as the man who brought jazz to England.
remember me to sb

data.chText: 代我问候某人
data.enText: used to ask sb to give your good wishes to sb else

data.chText: 代我向你的父母问好。
data.enText: Remember me to your parents.

simple_means.memory_skill: re 重新 + member 记忆；记 → 重新想起 → 回忆；记住

ex.chText: 他依然记得在乡下劳动的日子。
ex.enText: He still remembers the days when he worked in the country.

ex.chText: 我记得这本书已经还给你了。
ex.enText: I remember returning the book to you.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指记得（做过）某事时，通常后接名词、动名词、that 从句；指记得要做某事时，通常后接动词不定式。

ex.chText: 教授让他的学生背熟一首叶芝的短诗。
ex.enText: The professor had his students memorize a short poem of Yeats.
It is important to memorize these regulations.

synonyms.bx: 指将所有细节都牢牢记住或背熟。

ex.chText: 你能记起谁给你的那份文件吗？
ex.enText: Can you recall who gave that document to you?

ex.chText: 她想不起来曾经和他一起吃过饭。
ex.enText: She didn't recall having dined with him.

synonyms.bx: 指设法想起发生在过去的事情。

ex.chText: 她伤心地回忆起，她以前常和他去那个餐厅吃晚饭。
ex.enText: She recollected sadly that she used to have dinner with him in that restaurant.

ex.chText: 据他回忆，聚会开始时那个高个男子不在场。
ex.enText: As far as he can recollect, that tall man was not there when the party began.

synonyms.bx: 较正式用词，指力图想起有些许印象的事。

data.enText: be remembered for sth
be remembered as sth

data.chText: 因某事而成名（或名留青史）
data.enText: to be famous or known for a particular thing that you have done in the past

data.chText: 他因为将爵士音乐传到英格兰而为人们所熟知。
data.enText: He is best remembered as the man who brought jazz to England.
remember me to sb

data.chText: 代我问候某人
data.enText: used to ask sb to give your good wishes to sb else

data.chText: 代我向你的父母问好。
data.enText: Remember me to your parents.

example: I can't remember saying any such thing
I can't think what her last name was
can you remember her phone number?
Do you remember that he once loved you?

tr: keep in mind for attention or consideration
example: Remember to call your mother every day!
Think of the starving children in India!
he remembered how he used to pick flowers

tr: keep alive the memory of someone or something, as in a ceremony
example: We remembered the 50th anniversary of the liberation of Auschwitz
Remember the dead of the First World War

tr: exercise, or have the power of, memory
example: After the shelling, many people lost the ability to remember

tr: mention as by way of greeting or to indicate friendship

example: He remembered her in his will

value.def: If you remember people or events from the past, you still have an idea of them in your mind and you are able to think about them.

example.ex: You wouldn't remember me. I was in another group...
example.tran: 你不会记得我。我那时在另外一组。

example.ex: I certainly don't remember talking to you at all...
example.tran: 我当然完全不记得和你讲过话。

example.ex: I remember her being a dominant figure...
example.tran: 我记得她是一个举足轻重的人物。

example.ex: I remembered that we had drunk the last of the coffee the week before...
example.tran: 我记得我们在一个星期前就把最后的那点儿咖啡喝完了。

example.ex: I can remember where and when I bought each one...
example.tran: 我记得每一件东西是在何地何时买的。

example.ex: I used to do that when you were a little girl, remember?
example.tran: 在你还是小女孩的时候我曾经那么做过，记得吗？

value.def: If you remember that something is the case, you become aware of it again after a time when you did not think about it.

example.ex: She remembered that she was going to the social club that evening...
example.tran: 她记起来那晚她正要去社交俱乐部。

example.ex: Then I remembered the cheque, which cheered me up.
example.tran: 然后我想起了那张支票，这让我精神大振。

value.tran: (经过一段时间后)忆起，回忆起

value.def: If you cannot remember something, you are not able to bring it back into your mind when you make an effort to do so.

example.ex: If you can't remember your number, write it in code in a diary...
example.tran: 如果你记不住你的号码，用代码把它记在记事本上。

example.ex: I couldn't remember ever having felt so safe and secure...
example.tran: 我从未有过如此安全的感觉。

example.ex: I don't remember you asking me about that...
example.tran: 我不记得你问过我那件事情。

example.ex: I can't remember what I said...
example.tran: 我记不起来自己说了什么。

example.ex: Don't tell me you can't remember.
example.tran: 不要告诉我你记不起来了。

value.def: If you remember to do something, you do it when you intend to.

example.ex: I did remember to take the present...
example.tran: 我的确记得拿了礼物。

example.ex: Please remember to enclose a stamped addressed envelope when writing.
example.tran: 请记得写信时在信封里放一个贴好邮票、写明地址的信封。

value.def: You tell someone to remember that something is the case when you want to emphasize its importance. It may be something that they already know about or a new piece of information.

example.ex: It is important to remember that each person reacts differently...
example.tran: 重要的是要记住每个人的反应不同。

example.ex: It is worth remembering that children tend to copy their parents in this respect...
example.tran: 值得记住的是孩子们在这一方面往往会效仿父母。

example.ex: It should be remembered that this loss of control can never be regained.
example.tran: 要记住这种失控可能永远无法恢复。

value.def: If you say that someone will be remembered for something that they have done, you mean that people will think of this whenever they think about the person.

example.ex: At his grammar school he is remembered for being bad at games...
example.tran: 在文法学校他因不善于玩游戏为大家所熟知。

example.ex: He will always be remembered as one of the great Chancellors of the Exchequer.
example.tran: 作为最伟大的财政大臣之一他将永远被铭记。

value.def: If you ask someone to remember you to a person who you have not seen for a long time, you are asking them to pass your greetings on to that person.

example.ex: 'Remember me to Lyle, won't you?' I said...
example.tran: “代我问候莱尔，好吗？”我说。

example.ex: She asked to be remembered to you.
example.tran: 她要我转达对你的问候。

value.def: If you make a celebration an occasion to remember, you make it very enjoyable for all the people involved.

example.ex: We'll give everyone a night to remember...
example.tran: 我们将带给大家一个难忘的夜晚。

example.ex: I'll make it a birthday to remember.
example.tran: 我将使这成为一个难忘的生日。

value.boxu_tran: 不要混淆 remember和remind。remember 表示能够记起某事，如，He remembers everything that happened (他记得发生的每一件事)，I could not remember her name (我记不起她的名字)。remember 后接不定式，表示记住要做某事，如，He remembered to turn the gas off (他记得要关掉煤气)，Remember to put all your tools away (记得把你的工具全部收起来)。remind 表示使某人想起某人或某事，而 remember 无此用法。如，He reminds me of Maurice Fitzgerald (他让我想起莫里斯·菲茨杰拉德)，The pink dress reminds me of when I was a chauffeur in New York (这件粉色衣服让我想起自己在纽约当司机的日子)。注意：remember 后面可接动词不定式或-ing形式，但意思不同。接不定式时意为记得要去做某事，如，He remembered to buy his wife chocolates. (他记得要给妻子买巧克力)。而接-ing形式意为记得曾经做过某事，如，I remember reading the newspaper aloud to my father at five (我记得在5岁的时候大声给父亲读报纸)。
value.boxu_usage: Do not confuse remember and remind. If you remember something, you are able to bring it back into your mind. He remembers everything that happened... I could not remember her name. If you remember to do something, you do what you are meant to do without forgetting or needing to be told to do it. He remembered to turn the gas off... Remember to put all your tools away. If someone reminds you of someone or something, they make you think about that person or thing. You cannot use 'remember' in this way. He reminds me of Maurice Fitzgerald... The pink dress reminds me of when I was a chauffeur in New York. You can use remember with the 'to' infinitive or the '-ing' form of the verb, but note that they have different meanings. If you remember to do something, you do it when you intend to. He remembered to buy his wife chocolates. If you remember doing something, you are thinking back to the past. I remember reading the newspaper aloud to my father at five.

queryExplainVideo.detail: Remember vs remind 的含义和用法

partsOfSpeech.dec: a 无 + mnes 记忆；记 + ia 某种病 → 无记忆的病 → 健忘症
amnesia 健忘症 + c → 记忆缺失的，（引起）遗忘（症）的
partsOfSpeech.d: 记忆缺失的，（引起）遗忘（症）的

partsOfSpeech.dec: a 不 + mnes 记忆；记 + ty 表状态 → 不再记〔恨〕→ 赦免
com 共同 + memor 记忆；记 + able …的 → 值得纪念的
com 加强 + memor 记忆；记 + ate 做，造成，使… → 纪念
im 不 + memor 记忆；记 + ial …的 → 不能记得的 → 远古的
memor 记忆；记 + able 可…的 → 可记忆的 → 容易记住的
partsOfSpeech.d: 容易记住的；值得纪念的，难忘的

partsOfSpeech.dec: memor 记忆；记 + andum →〔帮助〕记的东西 → 备忘录
memor 记忆；记 + ial …的 → 纪念的
memor 记忆；记 + ize 使… → 记住，熟记
memor 记忆；记 + y 表结果 → 记忆，记忆力
re 重新 + member 记忆；记 → 重新想起 → 回忆；记住
